resample.funcdef:
def resample(
	self,
	date_col: str,
	time_period: str,
	mcols: List[str],
	scols: List[str]
)
resample.description: Resamples the `pl.DataFrame` object to a specific time period.

date_col.description: Name of the column containing the date or datetime values.

time_period.description:
Resample time period string. Possible values are:
- "1ns" (1 nanosecond)
- "1us" (1 microsecond)
- "1ms" (1 millisecond)
- "1s" (1 second)
- "1m" (1 minute)
- "1h" (1 hour)
- "1d" (1 day)
- "1w" (1 week)
- "1mo" (1 calendar month)
- "1y" (1 calendar year)
- "1i" (1 index count)

mcols.description: List of column names to resample with the mean function.

scols.description: List of column names to resample with the sum function.

rsum.description: Resamples the `pl.DataFrame` object and sum to a specific time period.

date_col.description: Name of the column containing the date or datetime values.

time_period.description:
Resample time period string. Possible values are:
- "1ns" (1 nanosecond)
- "1us" (1 microsecond)
- "1ms" (1 millisecond)
- "1s" (1 second)
- "1m" (1 minute)
- "1h" (1 hour)
- "1d" (1 day)
- "1w" (1 week)
- "1mo" (1 calendar month)
- "1y" (1 calendar year)
- "1i" (1 index count)

*cols.description: column names to resample with the sum function.

rmean.description: Resamples the `pl.DataFrame` object and mean to a specific time period.

date_col.description: Name of the column containing the date or datetime values.

time_period.description:
Resample time period string. Possible values are:
- "1ns" (1 nanosecond)
- "1us" (1 microsecond)
- "1ms" (1 millisecond)
- "1s" (1 second)
- "1m" (1 minute)
- "1h" (1 hour)
- "1d" (1 day)
- "1w" (1 week)

- "1y" (1 calendar year)
- "1i" (1 index count)

*cols.description: column names to resample with the mean function.
